description: The demolition of the existing podium and undercroft garages to create level access across the site, and the construction of approximately 36 new dwelling units, a mixture of flats and houses (all affordable homes)  in three locations: (1) two storey extension on the existing Quaker Court blocks including new lift access, (2) a new apartment block up to 7 storeys adjacent to and south of Braithwaite House facing on to Bunhill Row, and (3) new mews houses in location of existing podium, reinstating historic route into site (Roscoe Street). All new residential units provided with private amenity space. New communal room (150sqm) at the base of Braithwaite House.  New general storage room (450sqm) and cycle store (180sqm) beneath Quaker Court. Improved landscape and public realm, including enhanced children's play space. Car free development; majority of existing garages are not used, those with car parking spaces displaced by demolition will be reprovided with car parking spaces on nearby Islington Estate.
